sentence1: His way led him past the gardens of a wealthy gentleman, in which stood a number of tall buildings.
sentence2: Suddenly he saw something shining floating in the air inside the gardens, something which glowed like a ball of crystal.

sentence1: Suddenly he saw something shining floating in the air inside the gardens, something which glowed like a ball of crystal.
sentence2: He was astonished, and climbed the wall around the gardens, but there was not a human being in sight;

sentence1: He was astonished, and climbed the wall around the gardens, but there was not a human being in sight;
sentence2: all he saw was, at a distance, something which appeared to be a dog, looking up at the moon.

sentence1: all he saw was, at a distance, something which appeared to be a dog, looking up at the moon.
sentence2: Then the farmer realized that it was a fox, who was preparing the elixir of life.

sentence1: Then the farmer realized that it was a fox, who was preparing the elixir of life.
sentence2: He hid in the grass and waited until the ball of fire came down again, at about the height of his own head.

sentence1: He hid in the grass and waited until the ball of fire came down again, at about the height of his own head.
sentence2: Then he stepped hastily from his hiding-place, took it away and at once swallowed it.

sentence1: Then he stepped hastily from his hiding-place, took it away and at once swallowed it.
sentence2: And he could feel it glow as it passed down his throat into his stomach.

sentence1: And he could feel it glow as it passed down his throat into his stomach.
sentence2: When the fox saw what had happened he grew angry.

sentence1: When the fox saw what had happened he grew angry.
sentence2: He looked furiously at the farmer, but feared his strength.

sentence1: He looked furiously at the farmer, but feared his strength.
sentence2: For this reason he did not dare attack him, but went angrily on his way.

sentence1: For this reason he did not dare attack him, but went angrily on his way.
sentence2: From that time on the farmer-boy could make himself invisible, was able to see ghosts and devils, and had intercourse with the spirit-world.

sentence1: From that time on the farmer-boy could make himself invisible, was able to see ghosts and devils, and had intercourse with the spirit-world.
sentence2: In cases of sickness, when people lay unconscious, he could call back their souls, and if some one had committed a sin he could plead for them.

sentence1: In cases of sickness, when people lay unconscious, he could call back their souls, and if some one had committed a sin he could plead for them.
sentence2: He earned much money owing to these gifts.

sentence1: He earned much money owing to these gifts.
sentence2: When he reached his fiftieth year, he withdrew from all things and would no longer exercise his arts.

sentence1: When he reached his fiftieth year, he withdrew from all things and would no longer exercise his arts.
sentence2: One summer evening he was sitting in his courtyard, enjoying the cool air.

sentence1: One summer evening he was sitting in his courtyard, enjoying the cool air.
sentence2: While there he drank a number of goblets of wine, and by midnight had fallen fast asleep.

sentence1: While there he drank a number of goblets of wine, and by midnight had fallen fast asleep.
sentence2: Suddenly he awoke, feeling ill.

sentence1: Suddenly he awoke, feeling ill.
sentence2: It seemed as though some one were patting him on the back, and before he knew it, the ball of fire had leaped out from his throat.

sentence1: It seemed as though some one were patting him on the back, and before he knew it, the ball of fire had leaped out from his throat.
sentence2: At once a hand reached for it and a voice said: "For thirty long years you kept my treasure from me, and from a poor farmer-lad you have grown to be a wealthy man.

sentence1: At once a hand reached for it and a voice said: "For thirty long years you kept my treasure from me, and from a poor farmer-lad you have grown to be a wealthy man.
sentence2: Now you have enough, and I would like to have my fire-ball back again!"

sentence1: Now you have enough, and I would like to have my fire-ball back again!"
sentence2: Then the man knew what had happened, but the fox was gone.
